byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and MICHAEL WINERIP

abstract: Ouster of Norman Seabrook from leadership of Correction Officers Benevolent Assn raises questions about efforts to reform Rikers jail complex; Seabrook commanded fierce loyalty from correction officers under his representation, but was also willing to cooperate with some reforms.
lead_paragraph: The absence of the longtime president of New York City’s correction officers’ union, who is facing corruption charges, may pose headaches to advocates of jail reform.

headline.main: Norman Seabrook’s Ouster as Union Chief May Complicate Overhaul at Rikers
headline.print_headline: Powerful Union Leader’s Ouster Could Complicate Overhaul at Rikers

snippet: The absence of the longtime president of New York City’s correction officers’ union, who is facing corruption charges, may pose headaches to advocates of jail reform.
